snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission was asked  to intervene after a main company that provides real-time tallies of shareholder votes stopped giving the information to proposal sponsors.
abstract: Council of Institutional Investors asks Securities and Exchange Commission to intervene after Broadridge, provider of real-time shareholder vote tallies, stops giving information to groups that sponsor proposals.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission was asked  to intervene after a main company that provides real-time tallies of shareholder votes stopped giving the information to proposal sponsors.

headline.main: Investor Group Wants Real-Time Access to Proxy Votes
headline.print_headline: Investor Group Wants Real-Time Access To Proxy Votes

keywords.value: Securities Industry and Financial Markets Assn
keywords.name: organizations
